plugin.name: whichmob
plugin.author: Daniel Block
plugin.description:
Whichmob summary

Simple automation of the aardwolf hunt trick. Installs a .ht command.

trigger.title: fail
trigger.pattern: ^No\-one in this area by that name\.$

trigger.title: hunt1
trigger.pattern: ^You are almost certain that .*? is (.*?) from here\.$

trigger.title: hunt2
trigger.pattern: ^You are confident that (.*?) passed through here\, heading (.*?)\.$

trigger.title: hunt3
trigger.pattern: ^You couldn\'t find a path to (.*?) from here\.$

trigger.title: hunt4
trigger.pattern: ^You have no idea what you\'re doing\, but maybe .*? left .*?\?$

trigger.title: hunt5
trigger.pattern: ^The trail of .*? is confusing\, but you\'re reasonably sure .*? headed .*?\.$

trigger.title: hunt7
trigger.pattern: ^You are certain that .*? is .*? from here\.$

trigger.title: success
trigger.pattern: ^You seem unable to hunt that target for some reason\.$

plugin.script:
attempt = 1 target = nil
function finish() Note("\nAuto-hunt-trick completed.\n") SendToServer(".hht "..attempt.."."..target) disableTriggers() return true end
function failed() Note("\nAuto-hunt-trick failed.\n") disableTriggers() return true end
function start(mob) Note("\nAuto-hunt-trick engaged.\n") enableTriggers() target = mob attempt = 1 SendToServer("hunt "..attempt.."."..target) return true end
function advance() attempt = attempt+1 SendToServer("hunt "..attempt.."."..target) end
function enableTriggers() TriggerEnabled("success",true) TriggerEnabled("fail",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt1",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt2",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt3",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt4",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt5",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt6",true) TriggerEnabled("hunt7",true) end
function disableTriggers() TriggerEnabled("success",false) TriggerEnabled("fail",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt1",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt2",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt3",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt4",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt5",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt6",false) TriggerEnabled("hunt7",false)
end
RegisterSpecialCommand("ht","start")
